page.title: 16MANCHESTER SHIP CANAL.
page.content: The Moore Lane Swingbridge is one of a number of swingbridges on the{M.S.C.} This one is particularly important as it provides the only access to two big warehouse complexes owned by{Dupont} and{American Can(UK).}The bridge is manned 7 days a week,24 hours a day. There are eight men employed on the bridge,working in pairs.They work in 8 hour shifts 6am-2pm,2pm-10pm and 10pm-6am.As economy measure the company hope to introduce 1 man only shifts.Even then there is a danger of this section of the canal closing. Average of 10 ships a day.Main use is for{"Sludge Ships"}carrying the effluent of Manchester, Warrington, Runcorn and Bolton to be dumped at sea over Mersey Bar.Pipeline to be built so ships redundant as from 1987.The two men interviewed,Jim Berry & Jeff Millington each had 30 years service.
